intro: Eleocharis capillacea, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in wet or seasonally flooded soils, often found in marshes, swales, and along the edges of ponds. The plant has slender, cylindrical stems that are often covered in fine, hair-like structures. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are arranged in dense spikes, and it produces tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Eleocharis capillacea plays an important role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
